extendedIngredients.name: almond milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3/4 cup vanilla almond milk (or cow's milk; or soy milk; or plain almond milk)
metaInformation: (or cow's milk; or soy milk; or almond milk)

extendedIngredients.name: skim vanilla greek yogurt
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup vanilla greek yogurt (or plain; or regular yogurt; or even sour cream)
metaInformation: (or ; or regular yogurt; or even cream)

extendedIngredients.name: unsalted butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature

extendedIngredients.name: vanilla bean
extendedIngredients.originalString: seeds scraped from 1/2 split vanilla bean

recipes.title: Very Vanilla Cupcakes

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port are great choices for Cupcakes. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. The NV Solera Cream Sherry with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 350F degrees. Line muffin tin with 12 cupcake liners. Set aside.In a medium bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. In a large microwave-safe bowl, melt butter in the microwave. Stir in sugar - mixture will be gritty. Stir in egg whites, yogurt, milk, and vanilla extract until combined. Split 1 vanilla bean down the middle lengthwise. Scrape seeds from half of the vanilla bean into batter. Reserve other half.Slowly mix dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until no lumps remain. Batter will be thick.Divide batter among 12 cupcake liners (or 24 mini) and bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Bake for 8-9 minutes if making mini cupcakes. Allow to cool.To make the frosting, beat softened butter on medium speed with an electric or stand mixer. Beat for about 3 minutes until smooth and creamy. Add powdered sugar, cream, vanilla extract, and vanilla bean seeds with the mixer running. Increase to high speed and beat for 3 minutes. Add more powdered sugar if frosting is too thin or more cream if mixture is too thick. Add salt if frosting is too sweet (1/4 teaspoon). Frost cooled cupcakes (I used Wilton 1M piping tip). There may be leftover frosting depending how much you use on each cupcake.Store cupcakes in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days and in the refrigerator up to 7.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 350F degrees. Line muffin tin with 12 cupcake liners. Set aside.In a medium bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. In a large microwave-safe bowl, melt butter in the microwave. Stir in sugar - mixture will be gritty. Stir in egg whites, yogurt, milk, and vanilla extract until combined. Split 1 vanilla bean down the middle lengthwise. Scrape seeds from half of the vanilla bean into batter. Reserve other half.Slowly mix dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until no lumps remain. Batter will be thick.Divide batter among 12 cupcake liners (or 24 mini) and bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

Bake for 8-9 minutes if making mini cupcakes. Allow to cool.To make the frosting, beat softened butter on medium speed with an electric or stand mixer. Beat for about 3 minutes until smooth and creamy.
Add powdered sugar, cream, vanilla extract, and vanilla bean seeds with the mixer running. Increase to high speed and beat for 3 minutes.
Add more powdered sugar if frosting is too thin or more cream if mixture is too thick.

Add salt if frosting is too sweet (1/4 teaspoon). Frost cooled cupcakes (I used Wilton 1M piping tip). There may be leftover frosting depending how much you use on each cupcake.Store cupcakes in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days and in the refrigerator up to 7.
